channel.title: CVE Feed for mostafas1990 -- WP SMS – Messaging & SMS Notification for WordPress, WooCommerce, GravityForms, etc
channel.description: The latest CVEs for mostafas1990 -- WP SMS – Messaging & SMS Notification for WordPress, WooCommerce, GravityForms, etc

item.title: CVE-2023-6981|2024-08-02T08:50:06.882Z -- mostafas1990 -- wp%20sms%20%E2%80%93%20messaging%20%26%20sms%20notification%20for%20wordpress%2C%20woocommerce%2C%20gravityforms%2C%20etc
item.description: The WP SMS – Messaging & SMS Notification for WordPress, WooCommerce, GravityForms, etc plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to SQL Injection via the 'group_id' parameter in all versions up to, and including, 6.5 due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to append additional SQL queries into already existing queries that can be used to extract sensitive information from the database. This can leveraged to achieve Reflected Cross-site Scripting.

item.title: CVE-2023-6980|2024-08-02T08:50:06.932Z -- mostafas1990 -- wp%20sms%20%E2%80%93%20messaging%20%26%20sms%20notification%20for%20wordpress%2C%20woocommerce%2C%20gravityforms%2C%20etc
item.description: The WP SMS – Messaging & SMS Notification for WordPress, WooCommerce, GravityForms, etc plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 6.5. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the 'delete' action of the wp-sms-subscribers page. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to delete subscribers via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
